enumDescriptions: General improvement - Balanced approach for any coding prompt
Context-aware - Uses workspace context internally to provide specific, detailed improvements based on your actual codebase (files, classes, functions, patterns)
Concise - Quick improvements with minimal overhead
Custom - Use only your custom instructions (no preset)
promptImprover.systemPromptPreset.description: Choose a preset system prompt or use 'custom' for your own instructions. Changes take effect immediately.

promptImprover.systemPrompt.markdownDescription:
**Current Active System Prompt** - Shows and allows editing of the base prompt currently in use.

**Note:** This field updates automatically when you change the preset above. Any manual edits will be overwritten when you select a different preset.

**To customize:**
- **For presets:** Use the 'Additional Custom Instructions' field below to add your requirements (they won't be overwritten)
- **For custom mode:** Use the 'Additional Custom Instructions' field below to write your complete prompt

**Available placeholders:**
- `{userPrompt}` - The user's original prompt
- `{languages}` - Detected programming languages
- `{technologies}` - Detected frameworks/technologies
- `{openFiles}` - Currently open files

promptImprover.customSystemPrompt.markdownDescription:
**Additional Custom Instructions** - Add your own instructions that will be combined with the preset.

**How it works:**
- **When using presets** (General, Context-aware, Concise): Your custom instructions are appended to the preset
- **When using Custom preset**: Only your custom instructions are used (preset is ignored)

This allows you to enhance presets with your own requirements without replacing them entirely.

**Available placeholders:**
- `{userPrompt}` - The user's original prompt
- `{languages}` - Detected programming languages
- `{technologies}` - Detected frameworks/technologies
- `{openFiles}` - Currently open files

promptImprover.modelFamily.markdownDescription:
**Model Family** - Specify which model to use for prompt improvement.

Leave empty to use the default model, or enter a model family name.

**[Select Model from Available Options](command:prompt-improver.selectModel)** - Click to choose from a live list of available models.

**[List Available Models](command:prompt-improver.listAvailableModels)** - View all available models with their details.

Alternatively, you can manually enter a model family name (e.g., `gpt-4o`, `claude-sonnet-4`, `gemini-2.5-pro`).
